question.text:
Which of the following statement is/are correct with respect to remedy for plastic waste?

A. Polyblend is a fine mixture of recycled modified plastic.

B. It is a zero-waste procedure.

C. It was due to the collaboration of town people of Arcata and biologists of Humboldt State University.

D. A blend of polyblend and bitumen enhances bitumen’s water–repellent properties and helps to increase road life.

solution.text:
In Bangalore, a plastic sac manufacturer (Ahmed Khan) found solution to accumulating plastic waste. They form Polyblend, which is a fine powder of modified plastic waste. This polyblend is used to lay roads along with bitumen and due to this water repellent property of bitumen is increased by about three times. Water repellent property of bitumen was proved by Ahmed Khan in collaboration with R. V. College of Engineering and Bangalore City Corporation.

Zero Waste is a set of principles focused on waste prevention that encourages the redesign of resource life cycles so that all products are reused. The goal is for no trash to be sent to landfills, incinerators, or the ocean. Currently, only 9% of plastic is actually recycled.

Town people of Arcata collaborated with the biologists of Humboldt State University and created an ‘Integrated wastewater treatment system’. This included-
1. The conventional method of sedimentation, filtering, and chlorine treatment.
2. The development of a series of 6- connected Marshes (over 60 hectares of marshland).
